gitCommit.subject: feat(adaptive): implement shadow mode for safe rule testing (#79)
gitCommit.body:
feat(adaptive): implement shadow mode for safe rule testing (#79)

Implement ChatGPT's shadow mode recommendation - test rules before enforcing.

What is Shadow Mode:
- New learned rules start in 'shadow' mode
- Run on every PR but never block merge
- Report 'would have failed' (data collection)
- After verification, manually promote to 'enforce'
- Then rule actually blocks failing PRs

Changes:

1. Updated learned-rules.json schema:
   - Added 'mode' field (shadow or enforce)
   - Added 'shadow_failures' counter
   - Current rules: Both in shadow (safe default)

2. Updated scripts/preflight.sh:
   - Reads mode from learned-rules.json
   - Shadow: runs but doesn't block
   - Enforce: blocks on failure
   - Clear labeling in output

3. Updated scripts/run-adaptive-checks.sh:
   - Respects shadow vs enforce mode
   - Fixed subshell issue (process substitution)
   - Proper exit code handling

4. Updated scripts/telemetry/nightly_miner.ts:
   - New promotions start in shadow mode
   - Tracks shadow vs enforce status
   - Console output shows mode transitions
   - Deactivation logic for stale rules

5. Documentation:
   - telemetry/signatures/SHADOW-MODE.md
   - Complete explanation of lifecycle
   - Examples and manual promotion process

Benefits:
- ‚úÖ Safe experimentation with new rules
- ‚úÖ No risk of bad rules breaking pipeline
- ‚úÖ Collect data on rule effectiveness
- ‚úÖ Manual review before enforcement
- ‚úÖ LTDD-compliant (fail-forward, test in production)

Testing:
```bash
$ bash scripts/run-adaptive-checks.sh
‚ñ∂ Running learned check: wrong_host_signature [SHADOW MODE]
‚úÖ Passed
‚ñ∂ Running learned check: broken_pipe [SHADOW MODE]
‚úÖ Passed
‚úÖ All learned checks passed (or in shadow mode)
```

Tonight's Miner Run:
- New patterns (backend_ts_error, etc.) will promote
- All start in SHADOW mode (safe)
- Will report but not block
- After review: manually promote worthy rules to enforce

This implements ChatGPT's Phase B (HARDEN) recommendation.

AI-Tool: Cursor + ChatGPT
ChatGPT-Plan: Shadow mode for safe adaptation
Evidence: Tested locally, works correctly
